data.title: Custom texture compression for SpriteFonts

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
- Implemented a custom DXT3 compressor for font texture pages to eliminate block compression artifacts.
- iOS uses 16-bit colour textures for compressed font texture pages.
- Android already used 16-bit colour textures for compressed font texture pages as a side effect of ETC1 support.
- Added PremultiplyAlpha property to FontDescriptionProcessor for consistency (FontTextureProcessor and TextureProcessor already have the same property).

![customdxt3font](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/694943/20312208/5ad52988-ab9e-11e6-9855-5d52f710afaa.png)

Fixes #2853

data.body:
I wanted to modify the drawing behaviour for drawable game components in my project and stumbled upon this class while looking through the MonoGame source code. I think it would be a useful addition if one could make use of this to implement some custom behaviour for the Draw() and Update() methods regarding game components.

This is the class I am talking about, nested inside the Game class:
https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Game.cs#L773

data.title: Flickering. DrawUserIndexedPrimitives.
data.body:
Hello!

I have some troubles with DrawUserIndexedPrimitives method.

Here you can see an example of flickering. (DirectX)
https://github.com/krasnotsvetov/MonogameRenderBugExample

If I want to set offset in vertex declaration data and indices in DrawUserIndexedPrimitives i will have flickering of mesh which this method will draw.

How can i fix it?
Why can it happend?

P.S: here is video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2CBfgcWhiuw

data.title: Get content of project in MonoDevelop
data.body:
I'm trying to insert a PNG image in my game, but I'm not getting, the image is in Content/alien.png with the code below:

```
Texture2D alien;
.
.
.
protected override void LoadContent ()
{
    spriteBatch = new SpriteBatch (GraphicsDevice);
    Content.RootDirectory = "Content";
    alien = Content.Load<Texture2D>(@"alien");
}
```

When I run the game pops up the error message:

> **Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentLoadException: Could not load alien asset as a non-content file!** ---> Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentLoadException: The directory was not found. ---> System.IO.DirectoryNotFoundException: Could not find a part of the path "/home/leonardo/Documentos/Mono/MaisUM/MaisUM/bin/Debug/Content/alien.xnb". at System.IO.FileStream..ctor (System.String path, System.IO.FileMode mode, System.IO.FileAccess access, System.IO.FileShare share, System.Int32 bufferSize, System.Boolean anonymous, System.IO.FileOptions options) [0x001cf] in :0 at System.IO.FileStream..ctor (System.String path, System.IO.FileMode mode, System.IO.FileAccess access, System.IO.FileShare share) [0x00000] in :0 at at (wrapper remoting-invoke-with-check) System.IO.FileStream:.ctor (string,System.IO.FileMode,System.IO.FileAccess,System.IO.FileShare)
> at System.IO.File.OpenRead (System.String path) [0x00000] in :0 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.TitleContainer.OpenStream (System.String name) [0x00029] in :0 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentManager.OpenStream (System.String assetName) [0x0002e] in :0 --- End of inner exception stack trace --- at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentManager.OpenStream (System.String assetName) [0x00053] in :0 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentManager.ReadAsset[T] (System.String assetName, System.Action1[T] recordDisposableObject)
>   [0x00073] in <c33f6c525d914593acc9b590397e7c2b>:0   --- End of inner
>   exception stack trace ---   at
>   Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentManager.ReadAsset[T]
>   (System.String assetName, System.Action1[T] recordDisposableObject) [0x0012b] in :0 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentManager.Load[T] (System.String assetName) [0x00068] in :0 at MaisUM.Game1.LoadContent () [0x0002e] in /home/leonardo/Documentos/Mono/MaisUM/MaisUM/Game1.cs:46 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.Initialize () [0x0004d] in :0 at MaisUM.Game1.Initialize () [0x00002] in /home/leonardo/Documentos/Mono/MaisUM/MaisUM/Game1.cs:35 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.DoInitialize () [0x00011] in :0 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.Run (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameRunBehavior runBehavior) [0x00033] in :0 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.Run () [0x0000c] in :0 at MaisUM.Program.RunGame () [0x00010] in /home/leonardo/Documentos/Mono/MaisUM/MaisUM/Program.cs:31 at MaisUM.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00001] in /home/leonardo/Documentos/Mono/MaisUM/MaisUM/Program.cs:55


Probably the error is because he expects a xnb file, but I only have a .PNG because Linux does not found a way to convert. Could someone help me?

**Information:** Linux Elementary the Freya - MonoDevelop 5.10 - MonoGame 3.5

data.title: Don't lose textures when applying effect
data.body:
This is not necessary the correct behavior and I'm unable to test it on anything else than UltimaXNA but this XNA game expects textures are preserved when applying an effect multiple times and between frames. On MonoGame I had to reset them per effect apply.

As an additional note, the game in question has `RenderTargetUsage.PreserveContents` set for the graphics device.

data.title: AndroidGamePlatform throws NullReferenceException
data.body:
I haven't been able to replicate it myself yet, but keep receiving it in crash reports of my app.

At first I thought it was down to a particular android version but recently it's happened on anything from Android 6.0 to 4.4.

This is all I have to go on right now:
`Exception Type: System.NullReferenceException
Exception Message: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
Stack Trace:   at
Microsoft.Xna.Framework.AndroidGamePlatform.Activity_Paused (System.Object
sender, System.EventArgs e) [0x0003f] in
<6ba7fc465383472ca6acb46f39d1c0b7>:0
  at (wrapper delegate-invoke) <Module>:invoke_void_object_EventArgs
(object,System.EventArgs)
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.AndroidGameActivity.OnPause () [0x0000d] in
<6ba7fc465383472ca6acb46f39d1c0b7>:0
  at Android.App.Activity.n_OnPause (System.IntPtr jnienv, System.IntPtr
native__this) [0x00009] in <f5454c5d25554eabb77a78a444cfcaec>:0
  at (wrapper dynamic-method)
System.Object:3f2e087d-8371-4a97-a7e4-8a4e42687854 (intptr,intptr)`

It doesn't appear to touch any of my own code, which is what has made it extremely hard to track down. The lack of line numbers doesn't make it easy either.

Hopefully someone else has better luck, but in the meantime I'll keep my eye on it in case I find out what's causing it.

data.title: Develop branch v3.6.0.1089 play some sounds in the left speaker only (mono)
data.body:
When I play the game using the develop branch v3.6.0.1089 some sounds are played only in the left speaker only.

I don't know why some are played like that because all of them are .ogg files.

Also, you should test the songs too. In my case I only have one and it's played stereo but who knows having more than one.

Note: using the master branch this never happen.

I'm using Window 10 and DirectX.

data.title: Fixed broken link in documentation page.
data.body:
The link is broken in [Adding Art, Sounds, and More](http://www.monogame.net/documentation/?page=Adding_Art_Sounds_and_More) for Using TrueType Fonts.

The .md file name changed (or didn't match anyway) for the using fonts section.

Matches the .md in the [config](https://github.com/lozzajp/MonoGame/blob/documentation-font-link/Documentation/config.xml) that works fine.

data.title: Set the entry assembly when under test
data.body:
Fixes #5274  

Sourced from http://stackoverflow.com/a/21888521

data.title: Assembly.GetEntryAssembly() may be null when called during unit tests, causing OpenGL unit tests to fail.
data.body:
Assembly.GetEntryAssembly() is called to retrieve the game executable and set the icon for the SDL Window.   

setting the icon can either be skipped on null,  or an entry assembly can be set manually while creating the Game instance as described at http://stackoverflow.com/a/21888521

data.title: Use OpenGL flag when creating an SDL Window
data.body: Allows a graphics device to be created before the main window is created by enabling a OpenGL context to be bound to the Window.   This is the primary cause of failed OpenGL unit tests under Windows.

data.title: SpriteBatch.DrawString() antialiases fonts heavily despite PointClamp and integer-casted position
data.body:
I begin the Spritebatch with the PointClamp setting. All stretched/modified textures don't antialias, but fonts are heavily AA as seen below. I am not rendering using decimal floating point positions, as [this other issue](https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/issues/5242) suggests.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8285529/19929086/13a56f30-a0d8-11e6-9ddd-ddaf2da4b23b.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8285529/19929286/06d08730-a0d9-11e6-8466-10e61a0e6426.png)

I'm using Windows 10, DX. All machines I've tested on running Windows 10, 8, and 7 have the same issue. I have not tested on any other OS's. All .spritefonts I load have the same issue.

Import settings:

```
#begin DwellFont.spritefont
/importer:FontDescriptionImporter
/processor:FontDescriptionProcessor
/processorParam:TextureFormat=Color
/build:DwellFont.spritefont
```

Begin() call:

`spriteBatch.Begin(SpriteSortMode.Deferred, BlendState.AlphaBlend, SamplerState.PointClamp, null, null, null, null);`

Fixes that do NOT work:

- Using processorParam:TextureFormat:Compressed and NoChange
- Casting the draw Vector2 X and Y to integers
- Using a different font
- Using a different Windows operating system
- Upgrading from Monogame 3.4 to 3.5 (both have the issue)

[Related StackOverflow question with more info](http://gamedev.stackexchange.com/questions/132471/how-to-disable-monogame-pixel-font-antialiasing?noredirect=1#comment231061_132471).

data.title: Delete FontHelper.cs
data.body: As far as I see this file is not connected to anything, so time to test it out with the build server...

data.title: Rectangle.Contains is probably broken
data.body:
Hi!

Just a drive-by report. I saw this PR fixing `Rectangle.Contains` that was merged in FNA recently: https://github.com/FNA-XNA/FNA/pull/56

It looks like MonoGame might have the same bug: https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Rectangle.cs#L242
